answers.answer: Your issue does not appear to be diabetes related. Go to the ER and have it checked by a medical doctor. And, be sure to tell the ER doctor you were Rx'd Cipro as your infection may have progressed.

question: the inside of my lips and tip of my tongue are red and painful.  The dentist gave me lidex ointment, but it dulls the pain for a little while, then it comes back.  What is causing this?  She said it was probably from a antibiotic Cipro, but I only took that for 3 days then quit because it made me sick.  I've tried rinsing mouth with hydrogen peroxide.  The lidex ointment just burns! I am a type 2 diabetic and this is causing me to not even want to eat because it's so painful.
title: painful lips and tongue
